snippet: The loss, more than triple the deficit last year, includes a decline in revenue from mailing operations and accounting expenses related to the agency’s future retiree health benefits fund.
abstract: Postal Service reports record $15.9 billion net loss for fiscal year ended Sept 30, bringing financially troubled agency another step closer to insolvency; loss, though widely expected, is more than triple that in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The loss, more than triple the deficit last year, includes a decline in revenue from mailing operations and accounting expenses related to the agency’s future retiree health benefits fund.

headline.seo: U.S. Postal Service Reports $15.9 Billion Loss
headline.main: Postal Service Reports Loss of $15 Billion
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Reports Loss Of $15 Billion
